content.description: This climb is a little sketchy and some of the bolt placements are bad but it’s a fun day out on a small multi pitch. Pitch 1: This pitch starts out on very easy terrain as you pass the first and second bolt. The crux is at the third bolt with sloping footholds and hood jugs to pull up and over a small bulge. Continue up to the anchor. (5.6, 3 bolts)Pitch 2: Climb straight up a flake to the first bolt. After clipping the second bolt start up the headwall. This is the crux of the route as the hand holds get smaller and the feet are small but solid. Continue past the crux to good jugs at the top of the cliff. (5.7, 3 bolts)
content.protection: 3 bolts and two-bolt anchors on each pitch

content.description: This granite face has some good climbing on fairly solid rock. There is opportunities for both trad and sport climbers, or for those who love both. It's great for a small day out or if you are climbing in the area. This tower lies in a beautiful and quiet area with some cooler temps.
